front.title: Enhanced Performance Delay and Liveness Monitoring in Segment Routing Networks

abstract.t: Segment Routing (SR) leverages the source routing paradigm. SR is applicable to both Multiprotocol Label Switching (SR-MPLS) and IPv6 (SRv6) data planes. This document defines procedure for Enhanced Performance Delay and Liveness Monitoring (PDLM) in Segment Routing networks. The procedure leverages the probe messages compatible with the delay measurement message formats defined in RFC 5357 (Two-Way Active Measurement Protocol (TWAMP)) and RFC 8762 (Simple Two-Way Active Measurement Protocol (STAMP)) and is applicable to end-to-end SR Paths including SR Policies for both SR-MPLS and SRv6 data planes.
